captions.text: Hank: Good morning John, it's Friday.

John: In fact it is Black Friday, the day
--

Hank: The darkest Friday of the year, the
blackest, deepest, dark. It's so ominous.

John: Everything is 20% off at dftba.com through
Monday, I think that is great news.
Hank: It's bad for us.
John: It's kinda bad for us.
Hank: We're crazy!

John: Have you ever seen, uh, an advertisement
for "Don's Guns" in Indianapolis?
Hank: No, I don't live in Indianapolis.

John: He sells guns, and at the end of every
commercial, he says, "I don't want to make
any money, I just love to sell guns."
Hank: *laughs* It's basically --
John: That's how I feel about hoodies.

Hank: I'm glad you don't feel that way about
guns.
John: Let's start the video over.
Hank: I think that was all gold.
John: Okay!

Hank: Black Friday is the day that happens
after Thanksgiving.

John: Thanksgiving is the day where we say
what we are thankful for. So we thought that

today we would say some of the things that
we are thankful for.
Hank: Yeah!

John: I am thankful that childhood death around
the world is decreasing at an astonishing

pace, uh, that we are maybe only 30 or 40
years away from the vast majority of poor
countries being middle income countries.

Hank: That is a different direction than I
was going to go for the video. I was thinking

more like, "I'm thankful that farts sound
funny because otherwise they would just be

farts and it would just be stinky, but with
the funny sound, they're awesome.

John: I am also really grateful for Nerdfighteria,
uh, for like the chance to be part of a community

that's committed to doing good and also having
a lot of fun.

Hank: I'm thankful for, like, human hair.
Because I think it's like, I think it's pretty,
and functional.

Hank: I'm thankful for people who work in
customer support.

John: Uh, I'm so thankful for everyone who
works in retail today, I have worked a Black
Friday or two in my life and it is not easy.

John: I'm really grateful that there's this
young generation of people who are committed

activists and working hard to decrease Worldsuck
on lots of fronts in their communities. I
think that's really exciting -

Hank: I'm grateful for all the things that
you were grateful for. I'm also grateful that

my dog is cool with uh, me being the person
who decides when and where she poops. Like,
I would not put up with that.

John: You know what else I'm grateful for?
I'm grateful uh, that when I show up in Missoula,

Montana with no winter clothes because I've
been, uh, in North Carolina, that, uh, I happen

to own part of a warehouse that sells hoodies.
I can just layer myself in infinite hoodies.

Hank: Yeah, you could -- Right, you could
go from small all the way to extra extra large
and you could --

John: Realistically, I could go from large
all the way to extra extra large.
Hank: *laughs*

Hank: Here's one - Here's a serious one, here's
a serious one. I am thankful that the earth's

core is partially liquid, allowing for currents
in conductive materials that produce the earth's

electromagnetic field, which allows us to
go outside in the daytime and not die.
John: Is that really true?
Hank: Yeah -
John: I'm thankful for that -
Hank: *laughs*
John: That sounds like a huge win!
Hank: Yeah!

John: I'm also grateful that humans landed
a thing on a comet.
Hank: This is so much harder than it sounds.

John: It sounds incredibly hard! There's a
comet, it's like 'vrrrr, vrrr vrrrr' and we're

like "I know what we'll do. We'll shoot a
slingshot and it'll hit the comet."

You know what that reminds me of? The miracle
of AFC Wimbledon's journey to League Two!

I gave one of these to Henry and you know
what he said when I put it on him?
Hank: What?
John: He said, "I'm gonna grow into this."
Hank: *Laughs*

Hank: There's a lot of things to be thankful
for!

John: I wanna know what you're thankful for,
Nerdfighteria!

Hank: Yeah! I wanna know a serious thing you're
thankful for and a silly thing you're thankful
for.

John: I have to go and sign posters now. I
don't have the normal-est brain, and nothing

makes my brain feel calmer and happier than
signing over and over and over again. It brings

me great joy. Nerdfighters, thank you for
allowing me to sign so many things in the

last year. I hope to be able to keep it up
for the rest of my life.

Hank: That is weird. John, I will see you
on Friday.
John: It will be Tuesday, and also right now.
Hank: No Friday, today is Friday.
John: Oh! Perfect. Good ending.

John: Everything, everything here, everything
at dftba.com is 20% off now through Monday,

including signed posters, the hoodie that
I'm wearing, AFC Wimbledon scarves, everything

at dftba.com, we've got lots of amazing stuff,
it's all 20% off, so head over to dftba.com
link in the dooblydoo or click on my face.

title: Global Health and Human Hair: What the Vlogbrothers are Thankful For

comments.text:
WAIT. I've been watching all of the vlogbrothers videos from the beginning, 
and I'm so close to caught up. I just realized that the poster that I have 
hanging on my wall right now is one that I bought during THIS back friday 
sale... This is the first time I've watched something happen in the videos 
and known that I also experienced it. So I'm thankful for my poster (and 
the fact that John probably signed it after making this) :)﻿
comments.author: emilyfaith

comments.text:
I like how Hank is trying to be silly and John disregards him and goes on 
about serious things.﻿
comments.author: alexia gibson

comments.text:
Serious: that i live in a first world country and can eat everyday
Not so serious: that i can rant to my friends  about books they haven't 
read talking real fast and confuse the schnitzel out of them  ﻿
comments.author: jordan goldbloom

comments.text:
I'm worried that John is going to get some serious carpal tunnel from all 
of this signing he's doing. :(﻿

comments.text:
Suuuuuuper late, but I'm thankful for my kitties, because they always lay 
with me and purr when I'm feeling sick, and for crackers, 'cause they're 
the only food my body accepts unconditionally.﻿

comments.text: I'm so sick right now and your videos make me feel so much better ☺️﻿

It's not Thanksgiving and I'm not American or Canadian, but whatever. Silly

There are two types of people in the world.... Those thankful that world

comments.text: Very nice

i am thankful to live in such a small, friendly, accepting community and

did he ...

comments.text:

I am also thankful the obscene amount of desserts I just ate.﻿

comments.text: I am thankful for you guys making videoes﻿

comments.text: I am also thankful for fart noises and human hair.﻿

I grew up in Indianapolis, and I can't believe Don's Guns is still around.

comments.text:
I am balding and I find this video offensive. No, I don't. Find this video

comments.text:
This is quite late, but I am thankful for you guys. For giving me people to 
look up to and respect and always having a positive attitude. I'm thankful 
for your willingness to accept everyone into the community and making this 
such a great place to be.
I'm also thankful for pillows. They're great :D﻿

comments.text:
I am thankfull for having the hope my anxiety and OCD one day won't be a 
part of my life. I am also thankfull for cheese. ﻿
comments.author: elisabethenfrance

comments.text:
Serious thing I'm thankful for: Having family and friends who support my 
rather hard and silly dream to be a successful actress.
Silly thing I'm thankful for: Tortilla chips that taste good on their own 
since I don't like salsa. Basically Chipotle chips.﻿
comments.author: trekkiepirate

comments.text:
I'm thankful for living in such a fascinating world which I can help 
discover and create.
I'm also thankful for having finally gotten the courage to try sushi 
because now I'm not missing out on delicious raw fish.﻿
comments.author: Alberto Delgado

comments.text:
Serious thing I'm thankful for: my parents and their continued support both 
emotional and financial.
Silly thing: I'm thankful that tiny adorable clay sheep are a thing. :)﻿
comments.author: jazycool3

comments.text:
I'm thankful for you guys and nerdfighteria for helping me to help others 
when my own personal life isn't so easy to handle...I am also thankful for 
food. Food is good.﻿
comments.author: Rachel J

comments.text:
I'm thankful for the indomitable human spirit that has possessed so many 
people around the world recently in a fight to be recognized.
I'm thankful for lotion because my skin does not regenerate like 
Wolverine's and I would prefer not to have rivers of blood as hands.﻿
comments.author: LoonerFlight

comments.text: I love watching the opposite brother's face while one is talking.﻿

comments.text:

comments.text:
I'm grateful that to see you rwo in the same place at the same time! You

comments.text:
i am thank full for finding this and you guys other channels that can prove

comments.author: chris lee

comments.text:
I'm thankful for having two loving and supportive parents: my dad who is 
the only person who NEVER puts up with my crap, and my mom who keeps our 
family running smoothly and helps me solve everyday life problems that make 
me want to cry.
They also both listen to me talk about physics and calculus with these 
bemused looks on their faces.

I'm also thankful for gag reels, funny panels, terrible puns, and obscure 
geek jokes that very few people understand, because all of those things 
make me feel better after a frustrating day.

Some silly thinks I'm VERY thankful for: sparkly metallic star-shaped 
stickers, adorable stuffed animals, converse shoes, acoustic guitars, and 
the color red (specifically a deep, rose scarlet).﻿
comments.author: Annabeth Grace

comments.text:
I'm thankful for having the ability in my community to change the world 
because I know so many people who have the same, if not better ideas than 
mine, whose voices will never be heard. Also thankful for puppies. ﻿
comments.author: Justineisftw

comments.text: Hey, folks, now we all know John's hoodie size is large!﻿
comments.author: Viridis Arborem

comments.text:
I'm thankful for the fact that both my kidneys work (I know you can live 
with one but it's nice to have two) and that the doritos AND the salsa dip 
was on sale at the supermarket. At the same time.﻿
comments.author: Joyce Mo

comments.text:
Serious: earth
Silly: awesomeness﻿
comments.author: aunicornonline (theunicorn)

comments.text:
I'm thankful for the 340mg of medication that are the difference between

I'm also thankful that my favorite restaurant can have as silly a name as

comments.text:
i'm thankful for the existence of the Turritopsis(immortal jellyfish) and

comments.text:
I am thankful for early sea bacteria who created a ozon layer + for all the

comments.author: henk bert

comments.text:
I am thankful for all the diverse people in this world who just make the 
world and awesome place! I'm also thankful for Tuesdays and Fridays when I 
can take a break from the hustle and bustle of my life and immerse myself 
in nerdfighteria!﻿
comments.author: Emma P

comments.text:
I'm thankful for having discovered this channel because it reminds of the 
greater good about humanity, about the world & about being alive.

I'm thankful for everything I don't realize I should appreciate.﻿
comments.author: Dollyann San Jose

comments.text: "I'm gonna grow into this" -Henry Green 2014﻿
comments.author: Jen D

comments.text:
I am thankful for living in a place that does not try to limit my 
opportunities based on my sex or religion. As much as I can bash some of 
what the US does, I am just especially thankful right now that I don't have 
to endure the strong prejudices that some other people in the world are 
forced to endure. And for my funny thing, I am thankful that mac and cheese 
exists. Or just cheese in general. That stuff gets me through life﻿
comments.author: Lisa Meskimen

comments.text: My cousin lives im wimbledon﻿
comments.author: mWillia hSchlic

comments.text: 0:22 <-- Its a paradox!﻿
comments.author: Jordan Mortensen

comments.text:
I am thankful for clothes. I firmly believe that they are one of the best 
social constructs, because they let us not be naked. The first impression 
people can get of us is not how much cellulite we possess but how we choose 
to appear. (True, it does lead to classism sometimes, a lot of the time, 
but as for me personally, I am grateful.)

More serious thing: I am thankful that Juries are over and I have only like 
one real final this year. (Non-music majors: Juries are like an exam, 
except it's all at once for more than one professor and they start at you 
while you take it and judge you based on how well you do/how clogged your 
sinuses are that December and if you mess up, you can't erase it and start 
over. i.e. it's playing your instrument/singing your voice.)

Apparently most of my gratitude today is spent on things that make me feel 
less judged.﻿
comments.author: Kathryn A

comments.text: I'm very thankful for the force of gravity.﻿
comments.author: Jeremy Gross

comments.text:
Oh yeah, I'm also thankful for The Beatles.

And Gary Barlow and Mark Owen and Howard Donald and Jason Orange and Robbie 
Williams.﻿

comments.text:

im thankful that the earth has oil so we can have all the energy, who cares

comments.text:

comments.text:
I can't believe John thought he'd actually be in the position to correct

comments.author: Asia Sanchez

comments.text:
I am thankful for inexpensive education whenever I want it right here with 
you guys, or Khan academy, or hundreds of these fun and informative easily 
digestible bits. I get to pet my cat, make dinner, or fold clothes all 
while understanding more about the amazing world I live in.  I am an 
amazingly lucky lady!  
Also thankful for getting over body hair.  We all have some, the texture is 
actually quite nice, and it helps remind me how we are all just apes doing 
really odd things.  Putting together IKEA furniture really hammers this 
point home.﻿
comments.author: Laura Rathbun

comments.text: I'm thankful for fish eye lenses and distortion﻿
comments.author: Jason Lock

comments.text:
But if there were not magnetic fields created by the Earth's liquid core, 
we wouldn't be around to be thankful for them...﻿

comments.text:
I am thankful for a loving, supporting family whom I can call in an 
existential crisis, and I am thankful for the technology that is video 
games ﻿

comments.text:
John: I'm grateful for decreased child deaths and nerd fighteria...
Hank: I'm thankful farts sound funny!
Oh you...﻿

Can anyone tell me when Hank said the "read books (...) enjoy the ever

comments.text:
I'm thankful that my none of my suicide attempts have succeeded so far, and 
I'm thankful for pizza. All the pizza! omnomnomnom﻿

comments.text:
I am thankful for John Green and Hank Green for making vlog brothers. I am 
alsso thankful for living in a generation where being there is no racism. 
Hopefully many years from now when someone (hopefully vlog brothers) asks 
me what I'm thankful for i'll say equality﻿
comments.author: Litteraly NoLives

comments.text: ...but why is there a giant roll of bubble wrap sitting between you guys?﻿
comments.author: kelseypaiz

comments.text:
Also, I'm thankful for being able to have an education, a roof over my 
head, food in the pantry, and all the other things that I take for granted. 
And one other thing I am thankful for is Pizzamas. That was awesome!! ﻿
comments.author: Happy Haugen

comments.text:
So I just realized, why don't you guys make eight minute videos when you 
are reunited? That way you guys could both have your time. Just wondering.﻿

comments.text:
I just finished watching literally every video on the vlogbrothers channel, 
I am still working on your guys's other channels, with saying that this is 
my first comment because I finally feel as if I am a nerdfighter. So I must 
say French the llama you guys are freaking awesome!!! Thank you so much for 
everything you both do!!! This community literally inspires me every single 
day!!﻿

comments.text:
I am thankful for my amazing friends who are actually more like family and 
the ability to understand what you guys say. And on a more serious (read: 
silly) note...Chris Hemsworth. <3﻿
comments.author: Christina Johnston

comments.text: I am thankful for my boyfriend's heart. ﻿
comments.author: TheMKThornton

comments.text:
I am thankful for lovely friends.
I am also thankful for silly cat photos and weird John thoughts﻿
comments.author: Roman Penna

comments.text:
Everything so dangerous on black Friday :P Ah Hank has the best things to 
be thankful for :)﻿
comments.author: Roman Penna

comments.text: Hank should write a novel.﻿
comments.author: Zoravur Singh

comments.text:
I am thankful for the San Francisco Giants winning a 3rd World Series in 
five years this year - when I spent my whole life before 2010 thinking they 
would never, ever win one because they hadn't in my lifetime OR my Dad's 
lifetime and for reals my family loves the Giants more than we love each 
other so when the Giants win big, we love each other more. So that's a 
silly one and a real one. lol﻿
comments.author: Sami Higgins

comments.text:
I'm very thankful for literacy and the amount of knowledge available to us 
in this day and age. Also thankful for license plates that unintentionally 
spell words.﻿
comments.author: Kelly Smith

comments.text:
the difference between John and Hank's thankfulness is hilarious, John's 
like, "I am thankful for the strength of nerdfighteria, and for lower baby 
mortality rates......" and Hank's like, "I LOVE FUNNY FARTS!!!"  :D﻿
comments.author: grandhorn

comments.text:
I'm thankful for my family/friends, for Jesus Christ and his sacrifice, for 
food and shelter, for my country, and video games....ahh yes even video 
games. And food....let us not forget food.﻿
comments.author: DaGerminator

comments.text: I am thankful for good food ﻿
comments.author: pOrbb OO

comments.text:
I'm thankful that this planet has become the winning lottery ticket for all 
the species that have, do and will inhabit it. I am also thankful for 
chloroplasts, because if I had some I'd look like Martian stereotypes.﻿
comments.author: Adam Gustafson

comments.text:
I am thankful for National Novel Writing Month (NaNoWriMo). It's pretty 
much one of my favorite things in the world, and there's nothing like 
writing a novel every November!

As for what else I'm thankful for.. It's so hard to just pick two things. I 
can't think of something funny, so another kind of serious one. I'm 
thankful for language. Sometimes, it seems weird that a bunch of random 
squiggles and sounds constitutes words which enable us to communicate with 
one another.﻿
comments.author: Casey Jewels

comments.text:
Black Friday: when Nerdfighters are joined by much of the US to hide 
indoors from the annoying people outside.﻿
comments.author: G. Mary

comments.text:
I'm thankful that my youngest sibling is old enough for us to tell dirty 
jokes at family gatherings. I'm also thankful that I have a family that 
supports me even though I am a cranky teenager who can barely get out of 
bed in the morning.﻿
comments.author: Gwendolyn Lemley

comments.text: I'm thankful I clicked play! :)﻿
comments.author: Thomas Marciniak II

comments.text:
Thankful for (discovering) the vlogbrothers and nerdfighteria
and for living in this time and place.﻿
comments.author: Jason Schneijder

comments.text: I am thankful that you're filming Paper Towns here﻿
comments.author: Yofur McSheep

comments.text:
I'm thankful for my friends who will stay up until 3 a.m. just so we can 
get the chance to talk to each other.

I'm also thankful to have a boyfriend named Henry so that whenever John 
talks about his son I have a split second of confusion where I imagine my 
Henry doing whatever silly thing John's Henry is doing. ﻿
comments.author: Van

comments.text:
You guys are clearly nerds (props to you!!), but are you interested in 
comic books/graphic novels? If so, Marvel or DC, or do like Indy Comics? ﻿
comments.author: Zip Brett

comments.text:
Serious: I am thankful for Don't Forget to Craft Awesome and the dozens of 
friends I have made through the wonderfulness of THE INTERNET.
Silly: I am super thankful for cute foxes. And my wax warmer which looks 
like an owl.﻿
comments.author: Latitude Brown

comments.text: I'm thankful for pizza, and for Nerdfighteria.﻿
comments.author: Abbie AR

comments.text:
I am thankful for the friends that I have friends that don't understand my 
proud support of a community called Nerdfighteria or my quest to find more 
Nerdfighters or convert others into Nerdfighter yet they still support me 
and don't look at me too funny.
I am also thankful for LOVE. Humans capability to love one other﻿
comments.author: Number1ArmyDiva

comments.text:
I am thankful for all my friends and family who have supported me over the 
years. Also, I'm grateful the universe hasn't ceased to exist for one of 
infinite reasons. At least, not yet...﻿
comments.author: Brandt Campbell

comments.text:
I'm thankful for winter, because it means that I can stay in and watch 
youtube videos way more that is socially acceptable during the summer!
I'm also infinitely thankful for my friends, with whom we share political 
views, which is a very serious thing in todays Russia.﻿
comments.author: LoryRus
